text: Miyar kuka or miyan kuka, also known as Luru soup is a type of Nigerian dish from the northern part of Nigeria. It is also popular in Northern Ghana and Zongo communities in Ghana. The soup is made from powdered baobab leaves and dried okra. It is usually served with tuwo shinkafa, dawa or tuo zaafi. == Health benefits == The soup has many health benefits such as Calcium, Potassium, Phosphorus. ==See also== * List of soups * Nigerian cuisine * ==References== ==External Links== * Miyan Kuka Soup Category:Nigerian soups
title: Miyar kuka
